New Records: Bowden Francis took a no-hit bid into the 9th inning, the first pitcher since Nolan Ryan in 1989 to lose two no-hit bids in the 9th in the same season.
Francisco Lindor hit a home run to end Bowden Francis' no-hit bid in the 9th inning.
The Mets scored six runs in the 9th inning, the most by a team with no hits through 8 innings since the expansion era (1961).

Key Match Events: Bowden Francis carried a no-hit bid into the 8th inning.
Reed Garrett escaped a jam in the 7th inning.
Francisco Lindor's home run ended the no-hit bid in the 9th inning.
The Mets turned the game around with a six-run 9th inning.
Post-Match Reflections: Sean Manaea tipped his cap to Bowden Francis after the game.
The Mets' six-run 9th inning was a pivotal moment in their victory.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was analyzed using bat tracking for Francisco Lindor's home run.
Bowden Francis' no-hit bid was a rare achievement, not seen since Nolan Ryan in 1989.
The Mets' six-run 9th inning was the most by a team with no hits through 8 innings since the expansion era.
Others: Key at-bats: Francisco Lindor's home run, Pete Alonso's sacrifice fly, Starling Marte's RBI single, Addison Barger's RBI single.
